intro: Scorzonera persepolitana, commonly known as Persian scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Iran. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its striking yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine environments. It has a taproot system, which allows it to survive in harsh, arid conditions. Scorzonera persepolitana is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
